data.title: Countries that use the Kenyan shilling
data.meta_description: Usage and exchange rates of the Kenyan shilling. Convert KES to any other currency.
data.text:
The Kenyan shilling was established in 1966 as an official national currency and is used only in Kenya. It replaced the previously valid East African shilling. 1 Schilling is devided into 100 Cents.

ISO 4127:

KES

Numeric:

404

List of all currencies

Overview: Kenya

1.00 Kenyan shillings = 0.0077 US dollars

Currency:

Convert to:

Amount:

↔ Reverse currencies

Exchange rate history 1000 KES in USD

The graph shown here shows the exchange rate development from January 2018 to March 2024. The exchange rate for 1000 KES moved during this time from USD 9.91 to USD 7.11. In these 74 months it fell by 28.3 percent.

› Inflation development in Kenya

Currency reserves for the Kenyan shilling

According to the International Monetary Fund, the total broad money (M3) amounted to KES 6.045 trillion at the end of 2023. For currency hedging, reserves were held in a total amount of 1.027 trillion shillings. This corresponds to a ratio of 1:5.9. In other words, not even 1 of 5 shillings is deposited with a countervalue.

Approximately 81.02 billion shillings (7.9%) of the currency reserves exist in gold reserves. The remainder consists of foreign currencies, special drawing rights in the International Monetary Fund and other reserve positions.

› Worldwide currency and gold reserves

Sources

All conversion rates are based on data from the European Central Bank.

Data on currency and gold reserves are from the International Monetary Fund.
